registry of local mintable tokens and corresponding tokens on remote domains. This registry can be used by caller to determine which token on local domain to mint for a burned token on a remote domain, and vice versa. It is assumed that local and remote tokens are fungible at a constant 1:1 exchange rate.","kind":"dev","methods":{"acceptOwnership()":{"details":"The new owner accepts the ownership transfer."},"addLocalTokenMessenger(address)":{"details":"Reverts if a TokenMessenger is already set for the local domain.","params":{"newLocalTokenMessenger":"The address of the new TokenMessenger on the local domain."}},"burn(address,uint256)":{"params":{"burnAmount":"amount of tokens to burn. Must be > 0, and <= maximum burn amount per message.","burnToken":"burnable token address."}},"constructor":{"params":{"_tokenController":"Token controller address"}},"getLocalToken(uint32,bytes32)":{"params":{"remoteDomain":"Remote domain","remoteToken":"Remote token"},"returns":{"_0":"local token address"}},"linkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"details":"Associates a (`remoteToken`, `localToken`) pair by updating remoteTokensToLocalTokens mapping. Reverts if the remote token (for the given `remoteDomain`) already maps to a nonzero local token. Note: - A remote token (on a certain remote domain) can only map to one local token, but many remote tokens can map to the same local token. - Setting a token pair does not enable the `localToken` for deposits (that requires calling setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage.)"},"mint(uint32,bytes32,address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"reverts if the (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair does not map to a nonzero local token address. This mapping can be queried using getLocalToken().","params":{"amountOne":"Amount of tokens to mint to `recipientOne`","amountTwo":"Amount of tokens to mint to `recipientTwo`","burnToken":"Burned token address as bytes32.","recipientOne":"Address to receive `amountOne` of minted tokens","recipientTwo":"Address to receive `amountTwo` of minted tokens","sourceDomain":"Source domain where `burnToken` was burned."},"returns":{"_0":"mintToken token minted."}},"mint(uint32,bytes32,address,uint256)":{"details":"reverts if the (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair does not map to a nonzero local token address. This mapping can be queried using getLocalToken().","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to mint. Must be less than or equal to the minterAllowance of this TokenMinter for given `_mintToken`.","burnToken":"Burned token address as bytes32.","sourceDomain":"Source domain where `burnToken` was burned.","to":"Address to receive minted tokens, corresponding to `burnToken`, on this domain."},"returns":{"mintToken":"token minted."}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"pause()":{"details":"called by the owner to pause, triggers stopped state"},"pauser()":{"returns":{"_0":"Pauser's address"}},"pendingOwner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the pending owner."},"removeLocalTokenMessenger()":{"details":"Reverts if the TokenMessenger of the local domain is not set."},"rescueERC20(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw","to":"Recipient address","tokenContract":"ERC20 token contract address"}},"rescuer()":{"returns":{"_0":"Rescuer's address"}},"setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage(address,uint256)":{"details":"Burns with amounts exceeding `burnLimitPerMessage` will revert. Mints do not respect this value, so if this limit is reduced, previously burned tokens will still be mintable.","params":{"burnLimitPerMessage":"Maximum burn amount per message to set.","localToken":"Local token to set the maximum burn amount per message of."}},"setTokenController(address)":{"details":"newTokenController must be nonzero.","params":{"newTokenController":"address of new token controller"}},"tokenController()":{"details":"Returns the address of the tokenController","returns":{"_0":"address of the tokenController"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner."},"unlinkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"details":"Removes link from `remoteToken`, to `localToken` for given `remoteDomain` by updating remoteTokensToLocalTokens mapping. Reverts if the remote token (for the given `remoteDomain`) already maps to the zero address. Note: - A remote token (on a certain remote domain) can only map to one local token, but many remote tokens can map to the same local token. - Unlinking a token pair does not disable burning the `localToken` (that requires calling setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage.)"},"unpause()":{"details":"called by the owner to unpause, returns to normal state"},"updatePauser(address)":{"details":"update the pauser role"},"updateRescuer(address)":{"params":{"newRescuer":"New rescuer's address"}}},"title":"TokenMinterV2","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"LocalTokenMessengerAdded(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a local TokenMessenger is addedEmitted when a local TokenMessenger is added"},"LocalTokenMessengerRemoved(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a local TokenMessenger is removedEmitted when a local TokenMessenger is removed"},"SetBurnLimitPerMessage(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a burn limit per message is set for a particular token"},"SetTokenController(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when token controller is set"},"TokenPairLinked(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when a token pair is linked"},"TokenPairUnlinked(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when a token pair is unlinked"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"addLocalTokenMessenger(address)":{"notice":"Add TokenMessenger for the local domain. Only this TokenMessenger has permission to call mint() and burn() on this TokenMinter."},"burn(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Burn tokens owned by this TokenMinter."},"getLocalToken(uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Get the local token address associated with the given remote domain and token."},"linkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Links a pair of local and remote tokens to be supported by this TokenMinter."},"mint(uint32,bytes32,address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Mints to multiple recipients amounts of local tokens corresponding to the given (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair."},"mint(uint32,bytes32,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Mints `amount` of local tokens corresponding to the given (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair, to `to` address."},"pauser()":{"notice":"Returns current pauser"},"removeLocalTokenMessenger()":{"notice":"Remove the TokenMessenger for the local domain."},"rescueERC20(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Rescue ERC20 tokens locked up in this contract."},"rescuer()":{"notice":"Returns current rescuer"},"setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the maximum burn amount per message for a given `localToken`."},"setTokenController(address)":{"notice":"Set tokenController to `newTokenController`, and emit `SetTokenController` event."},"unlinkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Unlinks a pair of local and remote tokens for this zz-raw://957dbcf16ca085f461717e1649ff3278fdae19dcadda273ce59f3543c78ff52e","dweb:/ipfs/QmYxtdSqCPxx6dMoM2g97pT7tgij4PJryvngBp6Gj9UPpw"]}},"version":1}

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

addLocalTokenMessenger(address).details: Reverts if a TokenMessenger is already set for the local domain.

params.newLocalTokenMessenger: The address of the new TokenMessenger on the local domain.

params.burnAmount: amount of tokens to burn. Must be > 0, and <= maximum burn amount per message.

linkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32).details: Associates a (`remoteToken`, `localToken`) pair by updating remoteTokensToLocalTokens mapping. Reverts if the remote token (for the given `remoteDomain`) already maps to a nonzero local token. Note: - A remote token (on a certain remote domain) can only map to one local token, but many remote tokens can map to the same local token. - Setting a token pair does not enable the `localToken` for deposits (that requires calling setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage.)

mint(uint32,bytes32,address,address,uint.details: reverts if the (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair does not map to a nonzero local token address. This mapping can be queried using getLocalToken().

params.amountOne: Amount of tokens to mint to `recipientOne`
params.amountTwo: Amount of tokens to mint to `recipientTwo`
params.recipientOne: Address to receive `amountOne` of minted tokens
params.recipientTwo: Address to receive `amountTwo` of minted tokens

mint(uint32,bytes32,address,uint256).details: reverts if the (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair does not map to a nonzero local token address. This mapping can be queried using getLocalToken().

params.amount: Amount of tokens to mint. Must be less than or equal to the minterAllowance of this TokenMinter for given `_mintToken`.
params.to: Address to receive minted tokens, corresponding to `burnToken`, on this domain.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: called by the owner to pause, triggers stopped state

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

removeLocalTokenMessenger().details: Reverts if the TokenMessenger of the local domain is not set.

setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage(address,uint2.details: Burns with amounts exceeding `burnLimitPerMessage` will revert. Mints do not respect this value, so if this limit is reduced, previously burned tokens will still be mintable.

params.burnLimitPerMessage: Maximum burn amount per message to set.
params.localToken: Local token to set the maximum burn amount per message of.

tokenController().details: Returns the address of the tokenController

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

unlinkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32).details: Removes link from `remoteToken`, to `localToken` for given `remoteDomain` by updating remoteTokensToLocalTokens mapping. Reverts if the remote token (for the given `remoteDomain`) already maps to the zero address. Note: - A remote token (on a certain remote domain) can only map to one local token, but many remote tokens can map to the same local token. - Unlinking a token pair does not disable burning the `localToken` (that requires calling setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage.)

unpause().details: called by the owner to unpause, returns to normal state

addLocalTokenMessenger(address).notice: Add TokenMessenger for the local domain. Only this TokenMessenger has permission to call mint() and burn() on this TokenMinter.

burn(address,uint256).notice: Burn tokens owned by this TokenMinter.

getLocalToken(uint32,bytes32).notice: Get the local token address associated with the given remote domain and token.

linkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32).notice: Links a pair of local and remote tokens to be supported by this TokenMinter.

mint(uint32,bytes32,address,address,uint.notice: Mints to multiple recipients amounts of local tokens corresponding to the given (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair.

mint(uint32,bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Mints `amount` of local tokens corresponding to the given (`sourceDomain`, `burnToken`) pair, to `to` address.

removeLocalTokenMessenger().notice: Remove the TokenMessenger for the local domain.

rescueERC20(address,address,uint256).notice: Rescue ERC20 tokens locked up in this contract.

setMaxBurnAmountPerMessage(address,uint2.notice: Sets the maximum burn amount per message for a given `localToken`.

setTokenController(address).notice: Set tokenController to `newTokenController`, and emit `SetTokenController` event.

unlinkTokenPair(address,uint32,bytes32).notice: Unlinks a pair of local and remote tokens for this TokenMinter.

updateRescuer(address).notice: Assign the rescuer role to a given address.
